question: 測る
userExplanation: Wani:This version is usually used for scientific or medical measuring.
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>measure</kanji> so the verb vocab means <vocabulary>to measure</vocabulary>. This word generally has to do with scientific or medical measurements.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Remember another word that means "to measure?" It is <ja>量る</ja>, and has the same reading as this word. That should make things easier to remember.
